agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Pensions, Investments & Financial Services TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Thursday, April 11, 2019 PLACE: E2.026 CHAIR: Rep. Jim Murphy The Committee will meet to consider the following: HB 877 Oliverson | et al. Relating to the actuarial valuations of certain public retirement systems. HB 2227 Wu Relating to preventing the loss of benefits by certain retirees of the Teacher Retirement System of Texas who resume service. HB 2624 Perez Relating to the prosecution of certain criminal offenses involving fraud. HB 2625 Perez Relating to creating the criminal offense of mass fraudulent use or possession of credit card or debit card information. HB 2629 Flynn Relating to the deadline to appeal administrative decisions of the Teacher Retirement System of Texas. HB 2662 Paul Relating to voter approval of the issuance of certain obligations by municipalities to pay their unfunded liabilities to a public pension fund. HB 2763 Flynn | et al. Relating to the police pension fund in certain municipalities. HB 2945 Perez | et al. Relating to payment card skimmers on motor fuel dispensers; imposing a civil penalty; creating criminal offenses. HB 3292 Gutierrez Relating to sale-leaseback transactions. HB 3373 Middleton Relating to the police pension fund in certain municipalities. HB 3522 Murphy Relating to assignment of certain death benefits payable by the Employees Retirement System of Texas. HB 3599 Huberty Relating to certain increases in benefits under the firefighters' relief and retirement fund in certain municipalities. HB 3855 Longoria Relating to methods of computing interest charges on certain consumer loans. HB 4258 Murphy Relating to approval by the attorney general of certain bonds financing an educational facility for certain charter schools. HB 4452 Bonnen, Greg Relating to the authority of the legislature to vest the power to invest and manage certain public funds in certain officers, boards, and entities. HJR 143 Bonnen, Greg Proposing a constitutional amendment to authorize the legislature to vest the power to invest and manage certain public funds in certain officers, boards, and entities. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
